Thanks,

Genevieve,

messages.subject: Re: New in Quebec
messages.msgSnippet: ... is it ... act with ... than ... freedom ... I love the irony. Unschoolers worry that maybe they can t give four children all that they need, but many
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., starsuncloud@c... wrote:
> In a message dated 9/20/02 7:58:27 PM Central Daylight Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@y... writes:
>
> << Another question I have is feeding 4 curious minds at once...
is it
> possible? Do lots of you unschool more than 2-3? >>
>
> I have four natural learners here. And yes, it can be a balancing
act with
> everyone's needs at stake, but I can't imagine anything better
than
> unschooling. No other lifestyle could possibly give this much joy,
freedom
> and fuel the fires of curiosity better.
>
> Ren

I love the irony. Unschoolers worry that maybe they can't give four
children all that they need, but many others blindly accept that a
teacher can give 20-30 kids a sufficient education. The odds are
definitely in favor of the unschoolers.
love, Valerie

messages.subject: New in Quebec
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/20/02 7:58:27 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/20/02 7:58:27 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Another question I have is feeding 4 curious minds at once... is it
possible? Do lots of you unschool more than 2-3? >>

I have four natural learners here. And yes, it can be a balancing act with
everyone's needs at stake, but I can't imagine anything better than
unschooling. No other lifestyle could possibly give this much joy, freedom
and fuel the fires of curiosity better.

Ren
